Solar Panels: Develop a mobile app that helps users to calculate the amount of solar energy their homes can generate based on their location, roof size, and other factors. The app can also provide tips on how to optimize solar panel installation and usage.

Solar Powered Communities: Create a community-based initiative to install solar panels in every home in a specific area. This can be done through partnerships with local governments, non-profits, and private companies. The goal is to make solar energy accessible to everyone in the community and reduce their carbon footprint.

Solar Energy Incentives: Offer incentives to homeowners who install solar panels, such as tax credits, rebates, and grants. These incentives can help offset the cost of installation and make solar energy more affordable for everyone.
Solar-Powered Streetlights: Replace traditional streetlights with solar-powered versions. These lights can be charged during the day and used at night, reducing energy consumption and costs.

Solar-Powered Public Charging Stations: Install solar-powered public charging stations for electric vehicles. These stations can be charged using solar energy and provide a convenient and eco-friendly alternative to traditional gas stations.
